definition: (arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth

sentences.english: My friend Alan has asked me to be the best man at his wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友阿兰邀请我在他的婚礼上担任伴郎。

sentences.english: Would you like to be my groomsman?
My friend Alan invited me to act groomsman on his wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友Alan邀请我在他的婚礼上担任伴郎。

sentences.english: Her attendants will also carry flowers and the groom and his attendants will wear boutonnieres.
sentences.chinese: 新郎和他的伴郎则在纽扣孔上插着花。

sentences.english: My friend Alan invited me as his groomsman at the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友Alan邀请我在他的婚礼上担任伴郎。

sentences.english: My friend Alan invited me as the groomsman in his wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友Alan邀请我在他的婚礼上担任伴郎。

sentences.english: At weddings the best man will always make a toast.
sentences.chinese: 在这个婚宴上一般是伴郎他来说祝酒词。

sentences.english: Bob: Why? You are my groomsman.
sentences.chinese: 为什么？你是我的伴郎啊。

sentences.english: I'm so glad you're my best man.
sentences.chinese: 真高兴有你当我的伴郎。

sentences.english: M ike:Well, there's one more thing. I'd like you to be my best man.
sentences.chinese: 对了，还有件事，我希望你可以当我的伴郎。
为什么？你是我的伴郎啊。

sentences.english: It seems none of the groomsmen know where the rings are.
sentences.chinese: 而伴郎们看起来好像也都不知道戒指在哪里。

sentences.english: If he is the best man then why is Angela marrying the groom?
sentences.chinese: 如果他是伴郎，安吉拉为什么要和新郎结婚呢？

sentences.english: I'll have to be one of the groomsmen .
sentences.chinese: 那我就要加入伴郎的行列了。

sentences.english: My friend Alan invited me to be the groomsman in his wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友Alan邀请我在他的婚礼上担任伴郎。
